what: Data about hybrid open access journal publishing
title: Data about hybrid open access journal publishing
text: package contains information open access uptake hybrid journals. journals belong national transformative agreements Germany listed Open Access Monitor. main purpose hoaddata ship data hybrid open access monitoring dashboards, currently development SUB Göttingen support Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft. providing data R package, hoaddata can also used data analytics tasks R. Data cover publication period 2017 - 2022.

Data gathered https://doi.org/10.26165/JUELICH-DATA/VTQXLM, validated enriched ISSN variants. ?cc_jn_ind: Prevalence Creative Commons license variants year hybrid journal obtained Crossref. ?cc_openalex_inst_jn_ind: First author country affiliations per journal, year Creative Commons license

title: Data about hybrid open access journal publishing
text: ?cc_openalex_inst: Article-level affiliation data first authors obtained OpenAlex. Covers open access articles Creative Commons license hybrid journal.

title: Data about hybrid open access journal publishing
text: data-raw folder contains code used generate hoaddata datasets. data obtained interfacing subugoe-collaborative scholarly data warehouse, collection big scholarly datasets hosted Google Big Query maintained SUB Göttingen. Crossref used determining publication volume articles provided CC license, affiliation data gathered OpenAlex. can find corresponding SQL code inst/sql/ folder. data package automatically build GitHub Actions. merge event main branch triggers data update calling scripts data-raw/ folder. Data changes incorporated package tracked Git. makes easy update reproduce different version data contained hoaddata.

title: Data about hybrid open access journal publishing
text: Datasets released public domain. Anyone free copy, modify, publish, use, compile, sell, distribute materials form, purpose, commercial non-commercial, means. Crossref asserts claims ownership individual items bibliographic metadata associated Digital Object Identifiers (DOIs) acquired use Crossref Free Services. Individual items bibliographic metadata associated DOIs may cached incorporated user’s content systems. OpenAlex data made available CC0 license. work re-used following dataset: Pollack, Philipp; Lindstrot, Barbara; Barbers, Irene, 2021, “Open Access Monitor: Zeitschriftenlisten”, https://doi.org/10.26165/JUELICH-DATA/VTQXLM. published CC 4.0.

what: Prevalence of Creative Commons licenses by variant, year and journal — cc_jn_ind
title: Prevalence of Creative Commons licenses by variant, year and journal — cc_jn_ind
text: dataset contains number proportion articles Creative Commons license (CC) license variant year hybrid journals listed German Open Access monitor since 2017.

title: Prevalence of Creative Commons licenses by variant, year and journal — cc_jn_ind
Prevalence of Creative Commons licenses by variant, year and journal — cc_jn_ind
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 41319 rows 6 columns.

title: Prevalence of Creative Commons licenses by variant, year and journal — cc_jn_ind
text: Journal's article volume calculated using Crossref database snapshot. Note articles published regular issues aside supplements containing conference contributions like meeting abstracts, indicated non-numeric pagination included. Also, non-scholarly journal content, table contents excluded, following Unpaywall's paratext recognition approach, expanded include patterns indicating corrections. CC licenses also identified Crossref metadata records. License information author accepted manuscripts ("aam") time lag licensing publication (delayed OA) considered. Variables: issn_l Linking International Standard Serial Number (ISSN-L), umbrella ID media versions journal cr_year Earliest publication year (Crossref field `issued`) cc Normalized Creative Commons variant. Ordered factor license variant permissiveness cc_total Number articles Creative Commons variant jn_all Yearly journal output prop Proportion CC licensed articles

title: Prevalence of Creative Commons licenses by variant, year and journal — cc_jn_ind
